text:
Have JDK 1.2.2_007, TomCat 3.2.3, Cocoon 1.8.2, and IIS4 running on a quad 
processor NT 4 sp 6a server (note SQL Server 7.0 is also running although not 
being used).  We have an application on another machine which pushes XML files 
to the filesystem of this server.  Cocoon is used to marry XSL style sheets 
with the XML to push HTML files out through IIS.  

Important to point out we have other projects doing exactly this with no 
issues.  But this application (under no load as the site hasn't gone live yet) 
is unstable. When first loaded everything runs fine but then Java.exe in the 
task manager jumps, for no reason, to 100% utilisation for one of the CPUs.  
When we then go to browse the web site we find we get Dr. Watson errors.
creator: ray.richardson@gateway.com
ray.richardson@gateway.com
text:
Created attachment 724
Procedure followed when installing TomCat and Cocoon

The Java based Tomcat code shouldn't be able to generate any Dr. Watson 
errors.  They might be caused by a buggy VM.  Try switching to JDk 1.3.1 and 
see if the problems remain.

text:
I can't duplicate the problem and I expect it is a JVM bug on the 4 processor 
box.  I'd try upgrading to JDK 1.3.1 and see if that has any impact.
